bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October [7?], 1900

div1.p: Reed hopes that he won't have to wait as long as his friend to get married. He really needs a new bed, and requests that Emilie Lawrence Reed tell Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October [7?], 1900
div1.p:
Here it is
over a week since I last
wrote you and to me it seems
only yesterday-

To begin with
I had a letter from Dr Truby
at Columbia Bks this morning
and he said that Father left
Sunday on a Ward Liner
for Washington, so I imagine
that you will see him before
this gets off of the island so
I know that again you
are happy-

Your last letter
took an unusual long
time to reach me as I
only got it yesterday morning
I am glad that Blossom
has found a new friend
and I hope she will enjoy
herself very much this winter.
We are all wildly excited
over le just at present
and Capt Van Vhit, and Dr Goulding
make it quite interesting for Cooke
and myself -- although we manage
to beat them quite often, just
think here it is the middle of Oct.
and we are still swimming, fishing
and the like-

The Sedgwick arrived yesterday
and brought- Capt and Mrs Clarke
and Mrs Walton, Mrs C is from
Macon Ga and apparently a
charming lady about 36 years to
her credit. I was quite glad to
welcome them back-

Mrs Walton is a new york
Girl about 24 and very handsome
and attractive, she was a Miss
Ingrahm- Walon is Reg Armyy but
is attached to “F” Co, during the absence
of our own 1st Lieut. One Billy Rayburn

I suppose you received
Helen Cragin's engagement
cards, I really am glad
to see that at last they
are going to be married
and trust that I never
will have to wait as long
for my love who ever she is
at present the last girl I
hear from therefore constantly
changing from the New England
States, as far south as Georgia
drifting westward to Mo. and
some times switching way down
to the isle of Cuba, Do
you know where Cuba is-
I have heard of it but
I dont know exactly where
it stands on the map -- to
continue after wondering
off on such a subject, I say
I hope I shant have to
wait that long for my Mrs R.

Here is a bit of news for
you. Hunter and Miss Gooding
have announced their engagement
and are to be married this
winter right here in this post
so we are going to have a
little excitement.

Mother I have asked you
a lot of questions, and shall try and
quit it in the future but. I am
tired of sleeping on a Government bunk
as my feet always stick out about
6 inches.

What will a bed like the one
you had in the Company room
cost me, or better do you want to sell
me that one, now please let me
hear from you soon & dont fail to
answer this question, Tell dad to see
about my bike, I wrote Mr Meyers
all particulars
div1.closer: I am your devoted son Lawrence.
